About
Athan Bilal is a free software released under the GNU General Public License version 3.0. It uses prayer time calculation code from the Islamic Tools Library released by the Arab Eyes project. Its source is available at github.com/cdjalel/Bilal.\n \n Athan Bilal contains the coordinates of 23784 cities around the world, extracted from the geoname.org site under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License.\n \n The background image was designed by Freepick and licensed via www.freepick.com.\n \n There might be a slight difference between prayer times displayed here and the real times adopted by the mosques in your city. In such case, please try:\n - first to configure the right calculation method in the location settings.\n - Next, if your town/commune is very close to a big city, try to use its name instead in location settings.\n - Otherwise, send the name of your city (both in english and your local language), its exact coordinates (latitude, longitude and altitude) and its prayer time calculation method to our address: cdjalel@gmail.com, so we can fix it.

Athan Bilal channel Channel to show Athan Bilal Android notifications
Required User Permissions Warning
Please grant this app permission to set precise alarms to ensure you receive timely notifications for prayers and Athan. In \"Alarms & reminders\" settings, select \"Athan Bilal\" from the apps list, then check \"Allow settings alarms and reminders\" and press the Back button twice. Additionally, it is necessary to not optimize battery for this app, it does not consume lot of energy. In \"Battery optimization\" settings: choose All apps, select \"Athan Bilal\", check \"Don\'t optimize\", then press \"Done\" and the Back button.\n Denying these permissions may result in delayed notifications for prayer times and Athan when your device enters deep sleep mode.\n You can always manage these permissions in the app Settings -> Notifications -> Request permissions.
Grant permissions
Continue without permissions
Prayer time notifications and Athan may not work properly!
